text:
"Wrongly named patch released
Please be aware of this special update that was released for Windows 11
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ftopic%2Fkb5022370-setup-dynamic-update-for-windows-11-version-21h2-january-19-2023-e8b86249-d1c6-4cee-8969-1cadb07a45e3&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C00984c133c3c4799e8a508dc1cdc1506%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638416978775673841%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=P9c0KZMcevh9N7HpfGWFnTwnUb8r4QWLYjqZBfsoTHA%3D&reserved=0
The file offered is named
"windows10.0-kb5022370-x64_216ed6897b0f0194f9d48d2142b9f806b69e07f8.cab", but
should be named windows1_1_.0" this section is terribly wrong all Windows 11
21H2 updates had been always named Windows10.0-KBxxxxxx On 1/24/24, FlorianStosse wrote:
Link: None

metadata.subject: Re: [patchmanagement] Create/Recreate recovery partition
metadata.email_text_original:
[You don't often get email from abbodi86@gmail.com. Learn why this is important

The file offered is named
"windows10.0-kb5022370-x64_216ed6897b0f0194f9d48d2142b9f806b69e07f8.cab", but
should be named windows1_1_.0" this section is terribly wrong all Windows 11
